indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Indicator 01. # of women representatives in community-led governance structures in target locations (All Areas) Indicator 02. % of persons targeted for livelihood assistance reporting increased income-levels in target locations 06 months after having received support (disaggregated by gender) (All Areas) Indicator 03. # of persons targeted for micro-enterprise support reporting sustaining their enterprises 6 months after having received support (disaggregated by gender) (All Areas) Indicator 04. # persons using/accessing constructed/ rehabilitated infrastructure (disaggregated by gender) (All Areas) Indicator 05. % Increase in # of households reporting more than 5 occasions for interacting with a member from another village/ethnicity in past 06 months as a result of UNDP's interventions (disaggregated by gender) (All Areas) Indicator 06. % of households reporting perceptions of increased unity between people from other villages/communities in the past 6 months as a result of UNDP's interventions (disaggregated by gender) (All Areas) Indicator 07. % of trained participants who successfully apply the knowledge and skills on social cohesion gained from training initiatives into their work. (disaggregated by gender) Indicator 08. % of people surveyed who report that their level of trust toward others have increased as a result of their participation in training initiatives (disaggregated by gender) Indicator 09 . % Households purchasing technologies reporting and improved perception of women and youth as a result of market transactions facilitated by the programme (diaggregated by men and women) Indicator 10. # of Early Recovery strategies developed and implemented (national, Rakhine and Kachin); Indicator 11. Early Recovery principles integrated in humanitarian sector/ cluster response plans;

baseline.comment: Indicator 01. 25:100 women representatives in community-led governance structures in target locations Indicator 02. 0% of persons targeted for livelihood assistance reporting increased income-levels in target locations 06 months after having received support Indicator 03. % of persons targeted for micro-enterprise support reporting sustaining their enterprises 6 months after having received support Indicator 04. 300,000 persons using/accessing constructed/ rehabilitated infrastructure Indicator 05. 31% of households reporting more than 5 occasions for interacting with a member from another village/ethnicity in past 06 months Indicator 06. 0% of households reporting perceptions of increased unity between people from other villages/communities in the past 6 months as a result of UNDP's interventions Indicator 07. 0% of trained participants who successfully apply the knowledge and skills on social cohesion gained from training initiatives into their work. Indicator 08. 0% of people surveyed who report that their level of trust toward others have increased as a result of their participation in training initiatives Indicator 09 . 0% Households purchasing technologies reporting and improved perception of women and youth as a result of market transactions facilitated by the programme (diaggregated by men and women) Indicator 10. No Early Recovery strategies developed and implemented (national, Rakhine and Kachin); Indicator 11. 0 Early Recovery principles integrated in humanitarian sector/ cluster response plans;

target.comment: 1. 30:100 2. 70% 3. 70% 4. 200,000 5. 10% increased 6. 40% 7. 0 8. No integration of ER principles in humanitarian sector/ cluster

actual.comment: 466 (35.5%) of 1311 village-based CBO members are women, up from a baseline of 25:100. These mechanisms facilitate project implementation. Social protection assistance (through 194 rice banks) reached 89,847 persons (18,260 HHs), of which 46,364 (52%) are women, helping to reduce food insecurity among poor households. Capital assistance for livelihoods reached 93,665 persons (17,406 HHs) of which 46,612 (49.7%) were women, providing primary or supplementary income generation opportunities and thereby helping to reduce socio-economic disparities. 78.5% of those receiving livelihood assistance report an increase income-generation six months following the receipt of support; while 94.8% of those receiving assistance for small and micro enterprises report sustaining their business six months following the receipt of support. Upto 212750 (107501 women) are accessing new livelihood and community infrastructure, while upto 50111 (14590 women) benefitted from related cash-for-work schemes. As a result of UNDPs activities at the village level, there is a 52% increase in the number of persons reporting having more than five occasions for interacting with a member of a different community and 32% increase in the number of persons reporting perceptions of increased unity of people from different communities.

target.comment: Indiactor 1. 40:100 women representatives in community-led governance structures in target locations (All Areas) Indicator 2. 70% of persons targeted for livelihood assistance reporting increased income-levels in target locations 06 months after having received support Indicator 3. 80% of persons targeted for micro-enterprise support reporting sustaining their enterprises 6 months after having received support Indicator 4. 300,000 persons using/accessing constructed/ rehabilitated infrastructure Indicator 5. 46.5 households (50% increase) reporting more than 5 occasions for interacting with a member from another village/ethnicity in past 06 months Indicator 6. 50% of households reporting perceptions of increased unity between people from other villages/communities in the past 6 months as a result of UNDP's interventions (disaggregated by gender) (All Areas) Indicator 7. NA Indicator 8. NA Indicator 9. NA Indicator 10. Recovery Network Strategy developed for target locations (Rakhine and Kachin). Indicator 11. Integration of ER principles in at least 2 humanitarian sector/ cluster response plans
